title: How to Make Eba (a Nigerian Meal)

steps.headline: Purchase a reasonable quantity of cassava flour.
steps.description: In Nigeria, this is known as garri.

steps.headline: Bring some potable water to boiling point.
steps.description: Once the water is boiled, transfer some of it into a bowl.

steps.headline: As fast as you can, get the cassava flour (garri) and pour it little-by-little into the steaming water in the bowl.
Fill the bowl gradually with the flour.
steps.description: Fill until only a little water is left unabsorbed by the cassava flour (garri).

steps.headline: At this stage, use a wooden stirrer (known as an Omorogun in the Nigerian language Yoruba) to stir the contents of the bowl until you have a relatively homogeneous mix.
steps.description: Depending on the texture of Eba you want, add more water or more garri as desired to give the perfect consistency.

steps.headline: If you want a smoother texture and succulent manner, you can as well pound your eba like pounded yam.
Serve with Egusi, Draw, Ogbono, bitter leave or any other soup you like
The Eba is ready to be part of a beautiful meal.

text: Purchase a reasonable quantity of cassava flour. In Nigeria, this is known as garri. Bring some potable water to boiling point. Once the water is boiled, transfer some of it into a bowl. As fast as you can, get the cassava flour (garri) and pour it little-by-little into the steaming water in the bowl.  Fill the bowl gradually with the flour. Fill until only a little water is left unabsorbed by the cassava flour (garri). At this stage, use a wooden stirrer (known as an Omorogun in the Nigerian language Yoruba) to stir the contents of the bowl until you have a relatively homogeneous mix. Depending on the texture of Eba you want, add more water or more garri as desired to give the perfect consistency. If you want a smoother texture and succulent manner, you can as well pound your eba like pounded yam.  Serve with Egusi, Draw, Ogbono, bitter leave or any other soup you like  The Eba is ready to be part of a beautiful meal.  Enjoy!
